{{also|渠帅}}
==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=渠帅}}

===Etymology===
* [[渠]] (archaic meaning: [[big]]) + [[帥]] ([[commander]])

===Pronunciation===
{{zh-pron
|m=qúshuài
|cat=n
}}

===Noun===
{{zh-noun}}

# {{lb|zh|archaic}} leader of the local chapter of a bandit gang
#* ''c.'' '''1330 - 1400:''' [[w:Luo Guanzhong|Luo Guanzhong]], ''[[s:Romance of the Three Kingdoms/Chapter 1#5|Romance of the Three Kingdoms/Chapter 1]]''
#*: [[次後]][[徒眾]][[日]][[多]]，[[張角|角]][[乃]][[立]][[三]][[十]][[六]][[方]] --- [[大]][[方]][[萬]][[餘]][[人]]，[[小]][[方]][[六]][[七]][[千]]， --- [[各]][[立]]'''渠帥'''，[[稱]][[為]][[將軍]]。
#*:: ''Later on as he gathered more followers, [[w:Zhang Jiao|Zhang Jue]] organized his disciples into 36 chapters --- a large chapter numbered well over 10,000 people, whereas a small chapter might contain six or seven thousand, --- and each chapter had its own '''commander''', who was called a general.''
